comments:
Build 1218. Linux 7.2

The PDE self hosting does not run in build 1218 using the same workbench that I 
used for build 1206 in Linux.

When you select Run->Run Time Workbench from org.eclipse.ui you get a 
ClassNotFoundException reported on the console with no details.

org.eclipse.ui has errors when loaded into Linux due to OLE references but this 
code is never called. This may be related as there are references to classes 
not in the image in the org.eclipse.ui project.

Are you using the selfhosting workbench set-up created by 
org.eclipse.pde.selfhosting?
If yes then you should not use the PDE launcher but the Eclipse Launcher.

If you Run using Run->Eclipse you get the full stack trace

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ClassNotFoundException:
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.DelegatingURLClassLoader.loadClass(DelegatingURLClassLoader.java:755)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:257)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.startup(InternalBootLoader.java:914)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:809)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:285)
	at SlimLauncher.main(SlimLauncher.java:14)

works for us in 20011812 on both Linux and Windows.
Can you create a new self hosting workspace and run it under debugger and catch 
the ClassCastException so that you can find which class isn't found.

With -debug the stacktrace will tell you it cannot find

org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform

Here is the full trace

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ClassNotFoundException:
org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.InternalPlatform
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:811)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:285)
	at SlimLauncher.main(SlimLauncher.java:14)

If you add in the resources and runtime as referenced projects you can get
further but then you get a NullPointerException

java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.utils.Policy.bind(Policy.java:66)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.utils.Policy.bind(Policy.java:41)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceStatus.<clinit>(ResourceStatus.java:21)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.misc.StatusUtil.newStatus(StatusUtil.java:92)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPlugin.log(WorkbenchPlugin.java:415)
	at
org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.readPlatformAndProductInfo(Workbench.java:733)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.Workbench.run(Workbench.java:789)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.boot.InternalBootLoader.run(InternalBootLoader.java:821)
	at org.eclipse.core.boot.BootLoader.run(BootLoader.java:285)
	at SlimLauncher.main(SlimLauncher.java:14)

This PR got flagged as a blocker by SWT. 

We can run selfhosting on Linux with 20011218 so this must be a problem with 
this particular workspace. 

It is important to understand that there exist two PDE self hosting layouts:
- "old": required plugins are represented as JARs on the projects build class 
path. The launcher to be used for this layout: Run>Run Time Workbench
- "new": required plugins are represented as required projects on the build 
class path. The launcher to be used for this layout is: Run>Eclipse.

Launching one layout with the other launcher doesn't work. From the discussion 
below it isn't crystal clear which workspace layout is used, i.e. the old or 
new one.

In the case of the new one you should check that:
- org.eclipse.sdk is loaded into the workspace. The last walkback below
  indicates that the platform info file could not be found.

The old method was being used due to problems getting the new method with the 
PDE importing running. 

I loaded org.eclipse.ui and its required projects into the workbench and then 
converted to PDE project. I then corrected any classpath problems and ran using 
Run-> Run-time Workbench

When I run this using two images (without PDE) self hosting works fine.

Given that it works without PDE and PDE was involved in the set-up I don't 
think we can provide further help on this from the JDT side.

Steps to replicate:

- install and startup eclipse
- create new PDE plugin project with all default settings (use default template 
wizard)
- select your new project and choose "Run with Runtime Workbench"

Works on Win2K/Win98 but not on Linux.

given this steps someone from the PDE UI team should then look into this.
Added Vlad to the CC list.

I looked around at the WorkbenchLauncher class but couldn't see anything weird 
happening. In both the Linux and Win32 cases the workbench looks like its being 
started up with the same parameters. (targets look ok)

I also checked the contents of the pde_plugin_path.properties files and they 
look good too.

Have prompted PDE-UI for comment.

I think this bug is obsolete now that we PDE provides integrated selfhosting 
support.
Confirmed as no longer a problem using the integrated PDE.
